data.details:
Troop Pathways - Jacksonville Service Center

TROOP PATHWAYS
Prerequisite: GS101
Troop Pathways is part two of our required training for any new Girl Scout Leader or Co-Leader.  This 3-hour course is a continuation of the online training for GS101 and will cover a variety of topics included in the Volunteer Essentials training guide.  By the end of the session, participants will be able to identify resources available to them including the Adult Leader Guides, Girl Journeys, Safety Activity Checkpoints, and additional Council publications.  We will discuss the importance of inclusion and encouraging an age-appropriate girl led environment.   A wide variety of topics will be covered including but not limited to: conducting troop meetings, managing troop finances and reports, identifying child abuse, and understanding required troop documents.  These sessions fill up fast, so we encourage you to reserve your spot early.
